decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to aggressively dominate the battlefield with a combination of powerful creatures and direct damage spells. It focuses on efficiently using mana acceleration with cards like Llanowar Elves and Growth-Chamber Guardian to quickly develop a threatening board presence. The deck also includes disruptive elements with cards like Gruul Spellbreaker and Legion Warboss to disrupt opponents' gameplans. Additionally, the inclusion of Domri, Anarch of Bolas and Domri's Ambush provides additional value and removal options. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of aggressive creatures and well-timed spells.

The main concept of the deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells, card advantage engines, and powerful threats to outvalue the opponent. The deck focuses on using cards like Assassin's Trophy, Cast Down, and Command the Dreadhorde to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage with cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis. Additionally, cards like Wildgrowth Walker and Jadelight Ranger provide early game stabilization and life gain to help survive against aggressive strategies. Overall, the deck aims to grind out the opponent and secure victory through attrition.

This deck is a combination deck focused on using the cards Wilderness Reclamation and Nexus of Fate. The key concept revolves around using Wilderness Reclamation to untap your lands during your end step and generate a large amount of mana. This mana is then used to cast Nexus of Fate multiple times in a single turn, taking extra turns and preventing opponents from having a chance to respond. Other cards in the deck, such as Tamiyo, Collector of Tales and Search for Azcanta, help to dig for key combo pieces and provide additional control elements.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells. The goal is to efficiently deal damage as quickly as possible before the opponent can stabilize, utilizing cards like Experimental Frenzy and Chandra, Fire Artisan for card advantage and consistent damage output. The deck aims to control the board with efficient removal spells like Lightning Strike and Shock while also maintaining a steady stream of creatures like Ghitu Lavarunner and Goblin Chainwhirler to pressure the opponent's life total.

This deck focuses on building a board presence quickly and aggressively in order to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes a combination of powerful creatures such as Gideon Blackblade, Aurelia, Exemplar of Justice, and Lyra Dawnbringer along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Strike and Jaya's Immolating Inferno. The inclusion of cards like Mox Amber and Mobilized District allows for mana ramp and additional threats on the battlefield. The goal of the deck is to maintain pressure on the opponent while efficiently dealing with any threats they may present.

Utilize a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and planeswalkers to control the game and outvalue your opponent. Use cards like Thought Erasure to disrupt their hand, Teferi, Time Raveler to slow down their plays, and Kaya's Wrath to wipe their board. The finishers include Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Command the Dreadhorde to seal the deal. Narset, Parter of Veils acts as card advantage while Oath of Kaya provides some life gain. The deck aims to grind out the opponent's resources and win through card advantage and superior board control.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy by using counterspells, removal spells, and planeswalkers like Teferi. It generates value through cards like Hero of Precinct One and Elite Guardmage, while also utilizing cards like Narset to limit the opponent's resources. Command the Dreadhorde allows for a powerful late-game comeback, while Despark and Tyrant's Scorn provide additional removal options. The manabase is carefully constructed to support the Esper colors and ensure consistent casting of spells. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of control and card advantage.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, burn spells, and card draw for consistent damage output. By playing low-cost creatures like Goblin Chainwhirler and Viashino Pyromancer, along with burn spells like Lightning Strike and Shock, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Cards like Runaway Steam-Kin and Experimental Frenzy provide additional ways to generate value and maintain pressure on the opponent. This deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently to secure victories in a Standard 1v1 format.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through removal spells like Cast Down, Kaya's Wrath, and Oath of Kaya, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Thought Erasure. The main win condition revolves around the powerful planeswalkers Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler, which can generate card advantage and provide protection for your own spells. The inclusion of a few key threats like Basilica Bell-Haunt and Command the Dreadhorde allows the deck to apply pressure and close out games efficiently. The mana base is built to support the deck's diverse mana requirements.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through hand disruption, removal spells, and board wipes, while also gaining card advantage and controlling the game with powerful planeswalkers. By continuously disrupting the opponent's plays and maintaining a strong board presence with creatures like Basilica Bell-Haunt, the deck aims to grind out the opponent and eventually win with a large Command the Dreadhorde or by overwhelming them with Teferi, Hero of Dominaria's ultimate ability. It aims to control the game and dictate the pace of the match until it can secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by using a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler, along with removal spells like Kaya's Wrath and Thought Erasure. The deck also includes ways to generate card advantage and manipulate the opponent's hand with Narset, Parter of Veils and Search for Azcanta. The inclusion of cards like Oath of Kaya and Basilica Bell-Haunt provide additional tools for disruption and stabilizing the board. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can secure a win condition.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board and the opponent's resources using a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalker cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck also aims to generate value through cards like Elite Guardmage and Hero of Precinct One while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought Erasure and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck's win condition is to eventually overwhelm the opponent with card advantage and powerful threats like Hostage Taker and Command the Dreadhorde.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game through various spell and creature interactions. Utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Nicol Bolas, Dragon-God and Narset, Parter of Veils, as well as removal spells like Ritual of Soot and Bedevil, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage. Additionally, the deck includes versatile cards like Discovery / Dispersal and Search for Azcanta to help find key pieces and maintain card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and take control of the game through powerful spells and efficient removal.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes cards like Domri, Anarch of Bolas for added aggression and card advantage, and powerful creatures like Gruul Spellbreaker and Skarrgan Hellkite to deliver the finishing blows. The deck also uses removal spells like Lava Coil and Shock to control the board and ensure your creatures can keep attacking. Nullhide Ferox provides a solid body that is hard to deal with, while Rekindling Phoenix provides resilience against removal. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and win the game quickly.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix and power up Crackling Drake and Enigma Drake, taking advantage of cheap spells and Goblin Electromancer to cast multiple spells in one turn and deal damage to the opponent. Using card draw like Chart a Course and Opt, as well as removal spells like Lava Coil and Shock, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of small, efficient creatures backed up by powerful buffs and removal spells. The strategy revolves around playing multiple low-cost creatures quickly to build a wide board presence, then using cards like Benalish Marshal and Venerated Loxodon to beef up the team and push through damage. Cards like Conclave Tribunal and Gideon Blackblade provide additional removal and protection. The goal is to apply constant pressure and outpace the opponent before they can stabilize.
